titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Robert Allen Griffin Papers, 1942-1971
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Grace M. Hawes; machine-readable finding aid created by James Lake

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-12-05T12:27-0800

change.item: December 5, 2014: Revised to add photo file information July 31, 2012: Revised to update encoding and add unitid March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Robert Allen Griffin papers)//EN" "reg_287.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, speeches and writings, photographs, and printed matter, relating to American technical and economic assistance missions to China and Southeast Asia.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert Allen Griffin papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1975.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Reporter, Portland Oregonian and Portland Journal, Portland, Oregon
Secretary to First Polish Minister to U.S., Prince Lubormirski
Manager, American Polish Chamber of Commerce
Founder and publisher, Monterey Peninsula Herald, Monterey, California
Founder of radio station, KDON, Del Monte, California
Co-author, The School of the Citizen Soldier
Deputy Chief, U.S. Economic Cooperation Administration, China
Chief, U.S. Department of State Economic Mission to Southeast Asia
Director, U.S. Economic Cooperation Admnistration, Far East Program Division
Special Representative of the Far East, U.S. Economic Cooperation Administration and Mutual Security Agency

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Jessup, Ambassador at Large, Philip C.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, printed material, correspondence, etc., arranged alphabetically by title or subject

did.unittitle: Doughty, C. J., Jr., Briefs and analyses of newspapers,
Griffin, R. Allen - Trip to Washington, D.C.,
Chronological Highlights of the ECA Supply Situation During the North China Crisis
First Report for the Public Advisory Committee
Status of ECA Operations in Shanghai
Suggested Major Points for Aid-To-China Legislation
Summary of ECA China Aid Program,
Summary Statement - Extension of China Aid Program,
West China and the ECA Program
United States Information Service (USIS) - Daily News Bulletin, (incomplete)
United States Information Service (USIS) - Foreign Service News Digest, (incomplete)
St. Louis, George, "Observations on Communist China,"
Eller, E. M., "United States Disaster in China,"
International Conference on Agriculture and Cooperative Credit, Berkeley, California,
Meng, C. Y. W., "A Chinese View of American Aid," and Moy, E. K., "A Chinese-American View of American Aid,"
Mok, Poon-Kan, "Asia Today and the Western World,"
Moyer, Raymond T., "The Economic Cooperation Administration Program in Taiwan," Address before the Chinese Association for the United Nations at Taipeh, Taiwan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles and speeches by R. Allen Griffin, arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

did.unittitle: "The History of the 13th Infanty Regiment," (possibly written by R. Allen Griffin)
Memorandum on the Far East prepared for Ambassador at Large, Philip C. Jessup, (with Roger D. Lapham)
"On the Occasion of the Arrival of the 300th Shipload of Commodities for the China Aid Program,"
Speech for Mr. Richard Bissell on Asian problems, (outline)
"United States Policy Problems in Southeast Asia," Claremont, California,
Miscellaneous parts of speeches, notes, etc.
19 prints of R. Allen Griffin; 1 print of R. Allen Griffin with unidentified man; 2 negatives, undated

1 group print of Mr. and Mrs. Roger D. Lapham, Mr. and Mrs. R. Allen Griffin and others during U.S. Economic Cooperation Administration - China Mission, 1948-1949; 3 prints of R. Allen Griffin and others signing contracts related to U.S. Economic Cooperation Administration - China, 1948-1949; 5 prints of Paul G. Hoffman's visit to China, December, 1948, including group prints with Chiang Kai-shek, Li Tsung-jen, J. Leighton Stuart and Roger D. Lapham; 1 group print of R. Allen Griffin, Henry T. Samson, Roger D. Lapham, Dr. Sun of, Lewis Clark, Wu Te-chen; 7 negatives,
